t: Psalm 69
A Plea for Rescue
For the choir director: according to “The Lilies.” Of David.
Save*pn me, God, for*ln the water has risen to my neck.
I*ln have sunk in deep mud, and there is no footing; I*ln have come into deep water, and*ln a flood sweeps over me.
I*ln am weary from my crying; my*ln throat is parched. My*ln eyes fail, looking for my God.
Those*ln who hate me without cause are*ln more numerous than the hairs of my head; my*ln deceitful enemies, who would destroy me, are*ln powerful. Though*ln I did not steal, I must repay.
God,*pn you know my foolishness, and*ln my guilty acts are not hidden from you.
Do*ln not let those who put their hope in you be*ln disgraced because of me, Lord*ln God*s of Armies; do*ln not let those who seek you be*ln humiliated because of me, God*ln of Israel.
For*ln I have endured insults because of you, and*ln shame has covered my face.
I*ln have become a stranger to my brothers and*ln a foreigner to my mother’s sons
because*ln zeal for your house has consumed me, and*ln the insults of those who insult you have*ln fallen on me.
I*ln mourned and fasted, but*ln it brought me insults.
I*ln wore sackcloth as my clothing, and*ln I was a joke to them.
Those*ln who sit at the city gate talk about me, and*ln drunkards make up songs about me.
But*pn as for me, Lord,*s my*ln prayer to you is for a time of favor. In*ln your abundant, faithful love, God, answer*ln me with your sure salvation.
Rescue*ln me from the miry mud; don’t let me sink. Let*ln me be rescued from those who hate me and*ln from the deep water.
Don’t*ln let the floodwaters sweep over me or*ln the deep swallow me up; don’t*ln let the Pit close its mouth over me.
Answer*ln me, Lord,*s for*ln your faithful love is good. In*ln keeping with your abundant compassion, turn*ln to me.
Don’t*ln hide your face from your servant, for*ln I am in distress. Answer*ln me quickly!
Come*ln near to me and redeem me; ransom*ln me because of my enemies.
You*pn know the insults I endure — my*ln shame and disgrace. You*ln are aware of all my adversaries.
Insults*ln have broken my heart, and*ln I am in despair. I*ln waited for sympathy, but*ln there was none; for*ln comforters, but found no one.
Instead,*ln they gave me gall for my food, and*ln for my thirst they*ln gave me vinegar to drink.
Let*pn their table set before them be a snare, and*ln let it be a trap for their allies.
Let*ln their eyes grow too dim to see, and*ln let their hips continually quake.
Pour*ln out your rage on them, and*ln let your burning anger overtake them.
Make*ln their fortification desolate; may*ln no one live in their tents.
For*ln they persecute the one you struck and*ln talk about the pain of those you wounded.
Charge*ln them with crime on top of crime; do*ln not let them share in your righteousness.
Let*ln them be erased from the book of life and*ln not be recorded with the righteous.
But*pn as for me - poor and in pain — let*ln your salvation protect me, God.
I*ln will praise God’s name with song and*ln exalt him with thanksgiving.
That*ln will please the Lord*s more than an ox, more*ln than a bull with horns and hooves.
The*ln humble will see it and rejoice. You*ln who seek God, take heart!
For*ln the Lord*s listens to the needy and*ln does not despise his*ln own who are prisoners.
Let*pn heaven and earth praise him, the*ln seas and everything that moves in them,
for*ln God will save Zion and*ln build up the cities of Judah. They*ln will live there and possess it.
The*ln descendants of his servants will inherit it, and*ln those who love his name will live in it.
